title: Tapered Roller Bearings, Differential, Replace

steps.text: Remove transmission from vehicle - see operation "Transmission, Remove and Install"
Disassemble transmission - see operation "Transmission, Seal Completely"
Attach KM-6118-1 uniformly to KM-6118-2 (1); do not tilt. Tighten bolts (arrowed)

Press inner race of tapered roller bearing from differential (4) with KM-6118 (3) in conjunction with KM-500-5 (2) and workshop press (1) Note: This operation is described for inner race of tapered roller bearing in transmission housing side. Removal and installation of inner race of tapered roller bearing in clutch housing side is performed in a similar manner
Clean and check all parts; replace if necessary
When re-using old bearings, note allocation of shims (2) on differential (1)
Press inner race (2) flush onto differential (3) with KM-522 (1). At same time, KM-522 must also be positioned under differential to prevent damage to lower tapered roller bearing
Insert KM-6113 (2) in outer race (4) into recesses in transmission housing
Spread KM-6113 by tightening nut (3) in bearing, at the same time, counterhold spindle (1) Note: Claws of KM-6113 must engage in grooves (arrowed) of transmission housing

Counterhold shaft of KM-6113 (2), then pull outer race of tapered roller bearing out of transmission housing (3) by turning nut (1) Note: Removal of outer race of tapered roller bearing in clutch housing is performed in a similar manner
Clean all removed parts and check for wear and damage; replace if necessary
Insert outer race (1) in transmission housing

Drive outer race into transmission housing using KM-6114 (3) in conjunction with KM-523-1 (2) Note: Installation of outer race for tapered roller bearing in clutch housing is performed in a similar manner
Assemble transmission - see operation "Transmission, Seal Completely"
Install transmission into vehicle - see operation "Transmission, Remove and Install"

warnings:
When replacing
differential tapered roller bearings, respective outer races of
tapered roller bearing in clutch and transmission housings must
always be replaced. Ensure that shims under tapered roller bearings
are not interchanged

The edge (arrowed) of
KM-6118-2 (1) must engage under cage of
tapered roller bearing

When replacing inner
races of tapered roller bearings, outer races must also always be
replaced
